The formation or and modulation of nitric oxide (NO) levels in the lung has both beneficial and deleterious roles in airway diseases. NO is a potentially useful non-invasive marker of airway inflammation and has important regulatory functions in the lower airways. NO and  NO 3 − concentrations increase during inflammatory conditions such as asthma, bronchiectasis, and viral infections. Therefore, NO is important in the pathogenesis of cardiovascular disease as well as in the regulation of cardiovascular functions.
